V-230221.name: V-230221
V-230221.description: RHEL 8 must be a vendor-supported release.

V-230222.name: V-230222
V-230222.description: RHEL 8 vendor packaged system security patches and updates must be installed and up to date.

V-230223.name: V-230223
V-230223.description: RHEL 8 must implement NIST FIPS-validated cryptography for the following: to provision digital signatures, to generate cryptographic hashes, and to protect data requiring data-at-rest protections in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards.

V-230224.name: V-230224
V-230224.description: All RHEL 8 local disk partitions must implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure or modification of all information that requires at rest protection.

V-230225.name: V-230225
V-230225.description: RHEL 8 must display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting local or remote access to the system via a ssh logon.

V-230226.name: V-230226
V-230226.description: RHEL 8 must display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting local or remote access to the system via a graphical user logon.

V-230227.name: V-230227
V-230227.description: RHEL 8 must display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting local or remote access to the system via a command line user logon.

V-230228.name: V-230228
V-230228.description: All RHEL 8 remote access methods must be monitored.

V-230229.name: V-230229
V-230229.description: RHEL 8, for PKI-based authentication, must validate certificates by constructing a certification path (which includes status information) to an accepted trust anchor.

V-230230.name: V-230230
V-230230.description: RHEL 8, for certificate-based authentication, must enforce authorized access to the corresponding private key.

V-230231.name: V-230231
V-230231.description: RHEL 8 must encrypt all stored passwords with a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm.

V-230232.name: V-230232
V-230232.description: RHEL 8 must employ FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithms for all stored passwords.

V-230233.name: V-230233
V-230233.description: The RHEL 8 shadow password suite must be configured to use a sufficient number of hashing rounds.

V-230234.name: V-230234
V-230234.description: RHEL 8 operating systems booted with United Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) must require authentication upon booting into single-user mode and maintenance.

V-230235.name: V-230235
V-230235.description: RHEL 8 operating systems booted with a BIOS must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes.

V-230236.name: V-230236
V-230236.description: RHEL 8 operating systems must require authentication upon booting into rescue mode.

V-230237.name: V-230237
V-230237.description: The RHEL 8 pam_unix.so module must be configured in the password-auth file to use a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm for system authentication.

V-230238.name: V-230238
V-230238.description: RHEL 8 must prevent system daemons from using Kerberos for authentication.

V-230239.name: V-230239
V-230239.description: The krb5-workstation package must not be installed on RHEL 8.

V-230240.name: V-230240
V-230240.description: RHEL 8 must use a Linux Security Module configured to enforce limits on system services.

V-230241.name: V-230241
V-230241.description: RHEL 8 must have policycoreutils package installed.

V-230243.name: V-230243
V-230243.description: A sticky bit must be set on all RHEL 8 public directories to prevent unauthorized and unintended information transferred via shared system resources.

V-230244.name: V-230244
V-230244.description: RHEL 8 must be configured so that all network connections associated with SSH traffic terminate after becoming unresponsive.

V-230245.name: V-230245
V-230245.description: The RHEL 8 /var/log/messages file must have mode 0640 or less permissive.

V-230246.name: V-230246
V-230246.description: The RHEL 8 /var/log/messages file must be owned by root.

V-230247.name: V-230247
V-230247.description: The RHEL 8 /var/log/messages file must be group-owned by root.

V-230248.name: V-230248
V-230248.description: The RHEL 8 /var/log directory must have mode 0755 or less permissive.

V-230249.name: V-230249
V-230249.description: The RHEL 8 /var/log directory must be owned by root.

V-230250.name: V-230250
V-230250.description: The RHEL 8 /var/log directory must be group-owned by root.

V-230251.name: V-230251
V-230251.description: The RHEL 8 SSH server must be configured to use only Message Authentication Codes (MACs) employing FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic hash algorithms.

V-230252.name: V-230252
V-230252.description: The RHEL 8 operating system must implement DoD-approved encryption to protect the confidentiality of SSH server connections.

V-230253.name: V-230253
V-230253.description: RHEL 8 must ensure the SSH server uses strong entropy.

V-230254.name: V-230254
V-230254.description: The RHEL 8 operating system must implement DoD-approved encryption in the OpenSSL package.

V-230255.name: V-230255
V-230255.description: The RHEL 8 operating system must implement DoD-approved TLS encryption in the OpenSSL package.

V-230256.name: V-230256
V-230256.description: The RHEL 8 operating system must implement DoD-approved TLS encryption in the GnuTLS package.

V-230257.name: V-230257
V-230257.description: RHEL 8 system commands must have mode 755 or less permissive.

V-230258.name: V-230258
V-230258.description: RHEL 8 system commands must be owned by root.

V-230259.name: V-230259
V-230259.description: RHEL 8 system commands must be group-owned by root or a system account.

V-230260.name: V-230260
V-230260.description: RHEL 8 library files must have mode 755 or less permissive.

V-230261.name: V-230261
V-230261.description: RHEL 8 library files must be owned by root.

V-230262.name: V-230262
V-230262.description: RHEL 8 library files must be group-owned by root or a system account.

V-230263.name: V-230263
V-230263.description: The RHEL 8 file integrity tool must notify the system administrator when changes to the baseline configuration or anomalies in the operation of any security functions are discovered within an organizationally defined frequency.

V-230264.name: V-230264
V-230264.description: RHEL 8 must prevent the installation of software, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components from a repository without verification they have been digitally signed using a certificate that is issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that is recognized and approved by the organization.

V-230265.name: V-230265
V-230265.description: RHEL 8 must prevent the installation of software, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components of local packages without verification they have been digitally signed using a certificate that is issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that is recognized and approved by the organization.

V-230266.name: V-230266
V-230266.description: RHEL 8 must prevent the loading of a new kernel for later execution.

V-230267.name: V-230267
V-230267.description: RHEL 8 must enable kernel parameters to enforce discretionary access control on symlinks.

V-230268.name: V-230268
V-230268.description: RHEL 8 must enable kernel parameters to enforce discretionary access control on hardlinks.

V-230269.name: V-230269
V-230269.description: RHEL 8 must restrict access to the kernel message buffer.

V-230270.name: V-230270
V-230270.description: RHEL 8 must prevent kernel profiling by unprivileged users.

V-230271.name: V-230271
V-230271.description: RHEL 8 must require users to provide a password for privilege escalation.

V-230272.name: V-230272
V-230272.description: RHEL 8 must require users to reauthenticate for privilege escalation.

V-230273.name: V-230273
V-230273.description: RHEL 8 must have the packages required for multifactor authentication installed.

V-230274.name: V-230274
V-230274.description: RHEL 8 must implement certificate status checking for multifactor authentication.

V-230275.name: V-230275
V-230275.description: RHEL 8 must accept Personal Identity Verification (PIV) credentials.

V-230276.name: V-230276
V-230276.description: RHEL 8 must implement non-executable data to protect its memory from unauthorized code execution.

V-230277.name: V-230277
V-230277.description: RHEL 8 must clear the page allocator to prevent use-after-free attacks.

V-230279.name: V-230279
V-230279.description: RHEL 8 must clear SLUB/SLAB objects to prevent use-after-free attacks.

V-230280.name: V-230280
V-230280.description: RHEL 8 must implement address space layout randomization (ASLR) to protect its memory from unauthorized code execution.

V-230281.name: V-230281
V-230281.description: YUM must remove all software components after updated versions have been installed on RHEL 8.

V-230282.name: V-230282
V-230282.description: RHEL 8 must enable the SELinux targeted policy.

V-230283.name: V-230283
V-230283.description: There must be no shosts.equiv files on the RHEL 8 operating system.

V-230284.name: V-230284
V-230284.description: There must be no .shosts files on the RHEL 8 operating system.

V-230285.name: V-230285
V-230285.description: RHEL 8 must enable the hardware random number generator entropy gatherer service.

V-230286.name: V-230286
V-230286.description: The RHEL 8 SSH public host key files must have mode 0644 or less permissive.

V-230287.name: V-230287
V-230287.description: The RHEL 8 SSH private host key files must have mode 0640 or less permissive.

V-230288.name: V-230288
V-230288.description: The RHEL 8 SSH daemon must perform strict mode checking of home directory configuration files.

V-230290.name: V-230290
V-230290.description: The RHEL 8 SSH daemon must not allow authentication using known host’s authentication.

V-230291.name: V-230291
V-230291.description: The RHEL 8 SSH daemon must not allow Kerberos authentication, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.

V-230292.name: V-230292
V-230292.description: RHEL 8 must use a separate file system for /var.

V-230293.name: V-230293
V-230293.description: RHEL 8 must use a separate file system for /var/log.

V-230294.name: V-230294
V-230294.description: RHEL 8 must use a separate file system for the system audit data path.

V-230295.name: V-230295
V-230295.description: A separate RHEL 8 filesystem must be used for the /tmp directory.

V-230296.name: V-230296
V-230296.description: RHEL 8 must not permit direct logons to the root account using remote access via SSH.

V-230298.name: V-230298
V-230298.description: The rsyslog service must be running in RHEL 8.

V-230299.name: V-230299
V-230299.description: RHEL 8 must prevent files with the setuid and setgid bit set from being executed on file systems that contain user home directories.

V-230300.name: V-230300
V-230300.description: RHEL 8 must prevent files with the setuid and setgid bit set from being executed on the /boot directory.

V-230301.name: V-230301
V-230301.description: RHEL 8 must prevent special devices on non-root local partitions.

V-230302.name: V-230302
V-230302.description: RHEL 8 must prevent code from being executed on file systems that contain user home directories.

V-230303.name: V-230303
V-230303.description: RHEL 8 must prevent special devices on file systems that are used with removable media.

V-230304.name: V-230304
V-230304.description: RHEL 8 must prevent code from being executed on file systems that are used with removable media.

V-230305.name: V-230305
V-230305.description: RHEL 8 must prevent files with the setuid and setgid bit set from being executed on file systems that are used with removable media.

V-230306.name: V-230306
V-230306.description: RHEL 8 must prevent code from being executed on file systems that are imported via Network File System (NFS).

V-230307.name: V-230307
V-230307.description: RHEL 8 must prevent special devices on file systems that are imported via Network File System (NFS).

V-230308.name: V-230308
V-230308.description: RHEL 8 must prevent files with the setuid and setgid bit set from being executed on file systems that are imported via Network File System (NFS).

V-230309.name: V-230309
V-230309.description: Local RHEL 8 initialization files must not execute world-writable programs.

V-230310.name: V-230310
V-230310.description: RHEL 8 must disable kernel dumps unless needed.

V-230312.name: V-230312
V-230312.description: RHEL 8 must disable acquiring, saving, and processing core dumps.

V-230313.name: V-230313
V-230313.description: RHEL 8 must disable core dumps for all users.

V-230314.name: V-230314
V-230314.description: RHEL 8 must disable storing core dumps.

V-230315.name: V-230315
V-230315.description: RHEL 8 must disable core dump backtraces.

V-230316.name: V-230316
V-230316.description: For RHEL 8 systems using Domain Name Servers (DNS) resolution, at least two name servers must be configured.

V-230317.name: V-230317
V-230317.description: Executable search paths within the initialization files of all local interactive RHEL 8 users must only contain paths that resolve to the system default or the users home directory.

V-230318.name: V-230318
V-230318.description: All RHEL 8 world-writable directories must be owned by root, sys, bin, or an application user.

V-230319.name: V-230319
V-230319.description: All RHEL 8 world-writable directories must be group-owned by root, sys, bin, or an application group.

V-230320.name: V-230320
V-230320.description: All RHEL 8 local interactive users must have a home directory assigned in the /etc/passwd file.

V-230321.name: V-230321
V-230321.description: All RHEL 8 local interactive user home directories must have mode 0750 or less permissive.

V-230322.name: V-230322
V-230322.description: All RHEL 8 local interactive user home directories must be group-owned by the home directory owner’s primary group.

V-230323.name: V-230323
V-230323.description: All RHEL 8 local interactive user home directories defined in the /etc/passwd file must exist.

V-230324.name: V-230324
V-230324.description: All RHEL 8 local interactive user accounts must be assigned a home directory upon creation.

V-230325.name: V-230325
V-230325.description: All RHEL 8 local initialization files must have mode 0740 or less permissive.

V-230326.name: V-230326
V-230326.description: All RHEL 8 local files and directories must have a valid owner.

V-230327.name: V-230327
V-230327.description: All RHEL 8 local files and directories must have a valid group owner.

V-230328.name: V-230328
V-230328.description: A separate RHEL 8 filesystem must be used for user home directories (such as /home or an equivalent).

V-230329.name: V-230329
V-230329.description: Unattended or automatic logon via the RHEL 8 graphical user interface must not be allowed.

V-230330.name: V-230330
V-230330.description: RHEL 8 must not allow users to override SSH environment variables.

V-230331.name: V-230331
V-230331.description: RHEL 8 temporary user accounts must be provisioned with an expiration time of 72 hours or less.

V-230332.name: V-230332
V-230332.description: RHEL 8 must automatically lock an account when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur.

V-230333.name: V-230333
V-230333.description: RHEL 8 must automatically lock an account when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur.

V-230334.name: V-230334
V-230334.description: RHEL 8 must automatically lock an account when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur during a 15-minute time period.

V-230335.name: V-230335
V-230335.description: RHEL 8 must automatically lock an account when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur during a 15-minute time period.

V-230336.name: V-230336
V-230336.description: RHEL 8 must automatically lock an account until the locked account is released by an administrator when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur during a 15-minute time period.

V-230337.name: V-230337
V-230337.description: RHEL 8 must automatically lock an account until the locked account is released by an administrator when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur during a 15-minute time period.

V-230338.name: V-230338
V-230338.description: RHEL 8 must ensure account lockouts persist.

V-230339.name: V-230339
V-230339.description: RHEL 8 must ensure account lockouts persist.

V-230340.name: V-230340
V-230340.description: RHEL 8 must prevent system messages from being presented when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur.

V-230341.name: V-230341
V-230341.description: RHEL 8 must prevent system messages from being presented when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur.

V-230342.name: V-230342
V-230342.description: RHEL 8 must log user name information when unsuccessful logon attempts occur.

V-230343.name: V-230343
V-230343.description: RHEL 8 must log user name information when unsuccessful logon attempts occur.

V-230344.name: V-230344
V-230344.description: RHEL 8 must include root when automatically locking an account until the locked account is released by an administrator when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur during a 15-minute time period.

V-230345.name: V-230345
V-230345.description: RHEL 8 must include root when automatically locking an account until the locked account is released by an administrator when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur during a 15-minute time period.

V-230346.name: V-230346
V-230346.description: RHEL 8 must limit the number of concurrent sessions to ten for all accounts and/or account types.

V-230347.name: V-230347
V-230347.description: RHEL 8 must enable a user session lock until that user re-establishes access using established identification and authentication procedures for graphical user sessions.

V-230348.name: V-230348
V-230348.description: RHEL 8 must enable a user session lock until that user re-establishes access using established identification and authentication procedures for command line sessions.

V-230349.name: V-230349
V-230349.description: RHEL 8 must ensure session control is automatically started at shell initialization.

V-230350.name: V-230350
V-230350.description: RHEL 8 must prevent users from disabling session control mechanisms.

V-230351.name: V-230351
V-230351.description: RHEL 8 must be able to initiate directly a session lock for all connection types using smartcard when the smartcard is removed.

V-230352.name: V-230352
V-230352.description: RHEL 8 must automatically lock graphical user sessions after 15 minutes of inactivity.

V-230353.name: V-230353
V-230353.description: RHEL 8 must automatically lock command line user sessions after 15 minutes of inactivity.

V-230354.name: V-230354
V-230354.description: RHEL 8 must prevent a user from overriding the session lock-delay setting for the graphical user interface.

V-230355.name: V-230355
V-230355.description: RHEL 8 must map the authenticated identity to the user or group account for PKI-based authentication.

V-230356.name: V-230356
V-230356.description: RHEL 8 must ensure the password complexity module is enabled in the password-auth file.

V-230357.name: V-230357
V-230357.description: RHEL 8 must enforce password complexity by requiring that at least one uppercase character be used.

V-230358.name: V-230358
V-230358.description: RHEL 8 must enforce password complexity by requiring that at least one lower-case character be used.

V-230359.name: V-230359
V-230359.description: RHEL 8 must enforce password complexity by requiring that at least one numeric character be used.

V-230360.name: V-230360
V-230360.description: RHEL 8 must require the maximum number of repeating characters of the same character class be limited to four when passwords are changed.

V-230361.name: V-230361
V-230361.description: RHEL 8 must require the maximum number of repeating characters be limited to three when passwords are changed.

V-230362.name: V-230362
V-230362.description: RHEL 8 must require the change of at least four character classes when passwords are changed.

V-230363.name: V-230363
V-230363.description: RHEL 8 must require the change of at least 8 characters when passwords are changed.

V-230364.name: V-230364
V-230364.description: RHEL 8 passwords must have a 24 hours/1 day minimum password lifetime restriction in /etc/shadow.

V-230365.name: V-230365
V-230365.description: RHEL 8 passwords for new users or password changes must have a 24 hours/1 day minimum password lifetime restriction in /etc/login.defs.

V-230366.name: V-230366
V-230366.description: RHEL 8 user account passwords must have a 60-day maximum password lifetime restriction.

V-230367.name: V-230367
V-230367.description: RHEL 8 user account passwords must be configured so that existing passwords are restricted to a 60-day maximum lifetime.

V-230368.name: V-230368
V-230368.description: RHEL 8 must be configured in the password-auth file to prohibit password reuse for a minimum of five generations.

V-230369.name: V-230369
V-230369.description: RHEL 8 passwords must have a minimum of 15 characters.

V-230370.name: V-230370
V-230370.description: RHEL 8 passwords for new users must have a minimum of 15 characters.

V-230371.name: V-230371
V-230371.description: RHEL 8 duplicate User IDs (UIDs) must not exist for interactive users.

V-230372.name: V-230372
V-230372.description: RHEL 8 must implement smart card logon for multifactor authentication for access to interactive accounts.

V-230373.name: V-230373
V-230373.description: RHEL 8 account identifiers (individuals, groups, roles, and devices) must be disabled after 35 days of inactivity.

V-230374.name: V-230374
V-230374.description: RHEL 8 must automatically expire temporary accounts within 72 hours.

V-230375.name: V-230375
V-230375.description: All RHEL 8 passwords must contain at least one special character.

V-230376.name: V-230376
V-230376.description: RHEL 8 must prohibit the use of cached authentications after one day.

V-230377.name: V-230377
V-230377.description: RHEL 8 must prevent the use of dictionary words for passwords.

V-230378.name: V-230378
V-230378.description: RHEL 8 must enforce a delay of at least four seconds between logon prompts following a failed logon attempt.

V-230379.name: V-230379
V-230379.description: RHEL 8 must not have unnecessary accounts.

V-230380.name: V-230380
V-230380.description: RHEL 8 must not allow accounts configured with blank or null passwords.

V-230381.name: V-230381
V-230381.description: RHEL 8 must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon logon.

V-230382.name: V-230382
V-230382.description: RHEL 8 must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon an SSH logon.

V-230383.name: V-230383
V-230383.description: RHEL 8 must define default permissions for all authenticated users in such a way that the user can only read and modify their own files.

V-230384.name: V-230384
V-230384.description: RHEL 8 must set the umask value to 077 for all local interactive user accounts.

V-230385.name: V-230385
V-230385.description: RHEL 8 must define default permissions for logon and non-logon shells.

V-230386.name: V-230386
V-230386.description: The RHEL 8 audit system must be configured to audit the execution of privileged functions and prevent all software from executing at higher privilege levels than users executing the software.

V-230387.name: V-230387
V-230387.description: Cron logging must be implemented in RHEL 8.

V-230388.name: V-230388
V-230388.description: The RHEL 8 System Administrator (SA) and Information System Security Officer (ISSO) (at a minimum) must be alerted of an audit processing failure event.

V-230389.name: V-230389
V-230389.description: The RHEL 8 Information System Security Officer (ISSO) and System Administrator (SA) (at a minimum) must have mail aliases to be notified of an audit processing failure.

V-230390.name: V-230390
V-230390.description: The RHEL 8 System must take appropriate action when an audit processing failure occurs.

V-230392.name: V-230392
V-230392.description: The RHEL 8 audit system must take appropriate action when the audit storage volume is full.

V-230393.name: V-230393
V-230393.description: The RHEL 8 audit system must audit local events.

V-230394.name: V-230394
V-230394.description: RHEL 8 must label all off-loaded audit logs before sending them to the central log server.

V-230395.name: V-230395
V-230395.description: RHEL 8 must resolve audit information before writing to disk.

V-230396.name: V-230396
V-230396.description: RHEL 8 audit logs must have a mode of 0600 or less permissive to prevent unauthorized read access.

V-230397.name: V-230397
V-230397.description: RHEL 8 audit logs must be owned by root to prevent unauthorized read access.

V-230398.name: V-230398
V-230398.description: RHEL 8 audit logs must be group-owned by root to prevent unauthorized read access.

V-230399.name: V-230399
V-230399.description: RHEL 8 audit log directory must be owned by root to prevent unauthorized read access.

V-230400.name: V-230400
V-230400.description: RHEL 8 audit log directory must be group-owned by root to prevent unauthorized read access.

V-230401.name: V-230401
V-230401.description: RHEL 8 audit log directory must have a mode of 0700 or less permissive to prevent unauthorized read access.

V-230402.name: V-230402
V-230402.description: RHEL 8 audit system must protect auditing rules from unauthorized change.

V-230403.name: V-230403
V-230403.description: RHEL 8 audit system must protect logon UIDs from unauthorized change.

V-230404.name: V-230404
V-230404.description: RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/shadow.

V-230405.name: V-230405
V-230405.description: RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/security/opasswd.

V-230406.name: V-230406
V-230406.description: RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/passwd.

V-230407.name: V-230407
V-230407.description: RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/gshadow.

V-230408.name: V-230408
V-230408.description: RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/group.

V-230409.name: V-230409
V-230409.description: RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/sudoers.

V-230410.name: V-230410
V-230410.description: RHEL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/sudoers.d/.

V-230411.name: V-230411
V-230411.description: The RHEL 8 audit package must be installed.

V-230412.name: V-230412
V-230412.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the su command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230413.name: V-230413
V-230413.description: The RHEL 8 audit system must be configured to audit any usage of the setxattr, fsetxattr, lsetxattr, removexattr, fremovexattr, and lremovexattr system calls.

V-230418.name: V-230418
V-230418.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the chage command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230419.name: V-230419
V-230419.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the chcon command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230421.name: V-230421
V-230421.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the ssh-agent in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230422.name: V-230422
V-230422.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the passwd command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230423.name: V-230423
V-230423.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the mount command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230424.name: V-230424
V-230424.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the umount command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230425.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the mount syscall in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230426.name: V-230426
V-230426.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the unix_update in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230427.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of postdrop in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230433.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of unix_chkpwd in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230434.name: V-230434
V-230434.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the ssh-keysign in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230435.name: V-230435
V-230435.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the setfacl command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230436.name: V-230436
V-230436.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the pam_timestamp_check command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230437.name: V-230437
V-230437.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the newgrp command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230438.name: V-230438
V-230438.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the init_module and finit_module system calls in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230439.name: V-230439
V-230439.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the rename, unlink, rmdir, renameat, and unlinkat system calls in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230444.name: V-230444
V-230444.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the gpasswd command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230446.name: V-230446
V-230446.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the delete_module command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230447.name: V-230447
V-230447.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the crontab command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230448.name: V-230448
V-230448.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the chsh command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230449.name: V-230449
V-230449.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the truncate, ftruncate, creat, open, openat, and open_by_handle_at system calls in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230455.name: V-230455
V-230455.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the chown, fchown, fchownat, and lchown system calls in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230456.name: V-230456
V-230456.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the chmod, fchmod, and fchmodat system calls in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230462.name: V-230462
V-230462.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the sudo command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230463.name: V-230463
V-230463.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the usermod command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230464.name: V-230464
V-230464.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the chacl command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230465.name: V-230465
V-230465.description: Successful/unsuccessful uses of the kmod command in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230466.name: V-230466
V-230466.description: Successful/unsuccessful modifications to the faillock log file in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230467.name: V-230467
V-230467.description: Successful/unsuccessful modifications to the lastlog file in RHEL 8 must generate an audit record.

V-230468.name: V-230468
V-230468.description: RHEL 8 must enable auditing of processes that start prior to the audit daemon.

V-230469.name: V-230469
V-230469.description: RHEL 8 must allocate an audit_backlog_limit of sufficient size to capture processes that start prior to the audit daemon.

V-230470.name: V-230470
V-230470.description: RHEL 8 must enable Linux audit logging for the USBGuard daemon.

V-230471.name: V-230471
V-230471.description: RHEL 8 must allow only the Information System Security Manager (ISSM) (or individuals or roles appointed by the ISSM) to select which auditable events are to be audited.

V-230472.name: V-230472
V-230472.description: RHEL 8 audit tools must have a mode of 0755 or less permissive.

V-230473.name: V-230473
V-230473.description: RHEL 8 audit tools must be owned by root.

V-230474.name: V-230474
V-230474.description: RHEL 8 audit tools must be group-owned by root.

V-230475.name: V-230475
V-230475.description: RHEL 8 must use cryptographic mechanisms to protect the integrity of audit tools.

V-230476.name: V-230476
V-230476.description: RHEL 8 must allocate audit record storage capacity to store at least one week of audit records, when audit records are not immediately sent to a central audit record storage facility.

V-230477.name: V-230477
V-230477.description: RHEL 8 must have the packages required for offloading audit logs installed.

V-230478.name: V-230478
V-230478.description: RHEL 8 must have the packages required for encrypting offloaded audit logs installed.

V-230479.name: V-230479
V-230479.description: The RHEL 8 audit records must be off-loaded onto a different system or storage media from the system being audited.

V-230480.name: V-230480
V-230480.description: RHEL 8 must take appropriate action when the internal event queue is full.

V-230481.name: V-230481
V-230481.description: RHEL 8 must encrypt the transfer of audit records off-loaded onto a different system or media from the system being audited.

V-230482.name: V-230482
V-230482.description: RHEL 8 must authenticate the remote logging server for off-loading audit logs.

V-230483.name: V-230483
V-230483.description: RHEL 8 must take action when allocated audit record storage volume reaches 75 percent of the repository maximum audit record storage capacity.

V-230484.name: V-230484
V-230484.description: RHEL 8 must securely compare internal information system clocks at least every 24 hours with a server synchronized to an authoritative time source, such as the United States Naval Observatory (USNO) time servers, or a time server designated for the appropriate DoD network (NIPRNet/SIPRNet), and/or the Global Positioning System (GPS).

V-230485.name: V-230485
V-230485.description: RHEL 8 must disable the chrony daemon from acting as a server.

V-230486.name: V-230486
V-230486.description: RHEL 8 must disable network management of the chrony daemon.

V-230487.name: V-230487
V-230487.description: RHEL 8 must not have the telnet-server package installed.

V-230488.name: V-230488
V-230488.description: RHEL 8 must not have any automated bug reporting tools installed.

V-230489.name: V-230489
V-230489.description: RHEL 8 must not have the sendmail package installed.

V-230491.name: V-230491
V-230491.description: RHEL 8 must enable mitigations against processor-based vulnerabilities.

V-230492.name: V-230492
V-230492.description: RHEL 8 must not have the rsh-server package installed.

V-230493.name: V-230493
V-230493.description: RHEL 8 must cover or disable the built-in or attached camera when not in use.

V-230494.name: V-230494
V-230494.description: RHEL 8 must disable the asynchronous transfer mode (ATM) protocol.

V-230495.name: V-230495
V-230495.description: RHEL 8 must disable the controller area network (CAN) protocol.

V-230496.name: V-230496
V-230496.description: RHEL 8 must disable the stream control transmission protocol (SCTP).

V-230497.name: V-230497
V-230497.description: RHEL 8 must disable the transparent inter-process communication (TIPC) protocol.

V-230498.name: V-230498
V-230498.description: RHEL 8 must disable mounting of cramfs.

V-230500.name: V-230500
V-230500.description: RHEL 8 must be configured to prohibit or restrict the use of functions, ports, protocols, and/or services, as defined in the Ports, Protocols, and Services Management (PPSM) Category Assignments List (CAL) and vulnerability assessments.

V-230502.name: V-230502
V-230502.description: The RHEL 8 file system automounter must be disabled unless required.

V-230503.name: V-230503
V-230503.description: RHEL 8 must be configured to disable USB mass storage.

V-230504.name: V-230504
V-230504.description: A RHEL 8 firewall must employ a deny-all, allow-by-exception policy for allowing connections to other systems.

V-230505.name: V-230505
V-230505.description: A firewall must be installed on RHEL 8.

V-230506.name: V-230506
V-230506.description: RHEL 8 wireless network adapters must be disabled.

V-230508.name: V-230508
V-230508.description: RHEL 8 must mount /dev/shm with the nodev option.

V-230509.name: V-230509
V-230509.description: RHEL 8 must mount /dev/shm with the nosuid option.

V-230510.name: V-230510
V-230510.description: RHEL 8 must mount /dev/shm with the noexec option.

V-230511.name: V-230511
V-230511.description: RHEL 8 must mount /tmp with the nodev option.

V-230512.name: V-230512
V-230512.description: RHEL 8 must mount /tmp with the nosuid option.

V-230513.name: V-230513
V-230513.description: RHEL 8 must mount /tmp with the noexec option.

V-230514.name: V-230514
V-230514.description: RHEL 8 must mount /var/log with the nodev option.

V-230515.name: V-230515
V-230515.description: RHEL 8 must mount /var/log with the nosuid option.

V-230516.name: V-230516
V-230516.description: RHEL 8 must mount /var/log with the noexec option.

V-230517.name: V-230517
V-230517.description: RHEL 8 must mount /var/log/audit with the nodev option.

V-230518.name: V-230518
V-230518.description: RHEL 8 must mount /var/log/audit with the nosuid option.

V-230519.name: V-230519
V-230519.description: RHEL 8 must mount /var/log/audit with the noexec option.

V-230520.name: V-230520
V-230520.description: RHEL 8 must mount /var/tmp with the nodev option.

V-230521.name: V-230521
V-230521.description: RHEL 8 must mount /var/tmp with the nosuid option.

V-230522.name: V-230522
V-230522.description: RHEL 8 must mount /var/tmp with the noexec option.

V-230523.name: V-230523
V-230523.description: The RHEL 8 fapolicy module must be installed.

V-230524.name: V-230524
V-230524.description: RHEL 8 must block unauthorized peripherals before establishing a connection.

V-230525.name: V-230525
V-230525.description: A firewall must be able to protect against or limit the effects of Denial of Service (DoS) attacks by ensuring RHEL 8 can implement rate-limiting measures on impacted network interfaces.

V-230526.name: V-230526
V-230526.description: All RHEL 8 networked systems must have and implement SSH to protect the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted and received information, as well as information during preparation for transmission.

V-230527.name: V-230527
V-230527.description: RHEL 8 must force a frequent session key renegotiation for SSH connections to the server.

V-230529.name: V-230529
V-230529.description: The x86 Ctrl-Alt-Delete key sequence must be disabled on RHEL 8.

V-230530.name: V-230530
V-230530.description: The x86 Ctrl-Alt-Delete key sequence in RHEL 8 must be disabled if a graphical user interface is installed.

V-230531.name: V-230531
V-230531.description: The systemd Ctrl-Alt-Delete burst key sequence in RHEL 8 must be disabled.

V-230532.name: V-230532
V-230532.description: The debug-shell systemd service must be disabled on RHEL 8.

V-230533.name: V-230533
V-230533.description: The Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) server package must not be installed if not required for RHEL 8 operational support.

V-230534.name: V-230534
V-230534.description: The root account must be the only account having unrestricted access to the RHEL 8 system.

V-230535.name: V-230535
V-230535.description: RHEL 8 must prevent IPv6 Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages from being accepted.

V-230536.name: V-230536
V-230536.description: RHEL 8 must not send Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects.

V-230537.name: V-230537
V-230537.description: RHEL 8 must not respond to Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) echoes sent to a broadcast address.

V-230538.name: V-230538
V-230538.description: RHEL 8 must not forward IPv6 source-routed packets.

V-230539.name: V-230539
V-230539.description: RHEL 8 must not forward IPv6 source-routed packets by default.

V-230540.name: V-230540
V-230540.description: RHEL 8 must not enable IPv6 packet forwarding unless the system is a router.

V-230541.name: V-230541
V-230541.description: RHEL 8 must not accept router advertisements on all IPv6 interfaces.

V-230542.name: V-230542
V-230542.description: RHEL 8 must not accept router advertisements on all IPv6 interfaces by default.

V-230543.name: V-230543
V-230543.description: RHEL 8 must not allow interfaces to perform Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects by default.

V-230544.name: V-230544
V-230544.description: RHEL 8 must ignore IPv6 Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages.

V-230545.name: V-230545
V-230545.description: RHEL 8 must disable access to network bpf syscall from unprivileged processes.

V-230546.name: V-230546
V-230546.description: RHEL 8 must restrict usage of ptrace to descendant  processes.

V-230547.name: V-230547
V-230547.description: RHEL 8 must restrict exposed kernel pointer addresses access.

V-230548.name: V-230548
V-230548.description: RHEL 8 must disable the use of user namespaces.

V-230549.name: V-230549
V-230549.description: RHEL 8 must use reverse path filtering on all IPv4 interfaces.

V-230550.name: V-230550
V-230550.description: RHEL 8 must be configured to prevent unrestricted mail relaying.

V-230551.name: V-230551
V-230551.description: The RHEL 8 file integrity tool must be configured to verify extended attributes.

V-230552.name: V-230552
V-230552.description: The RHEL 8 file integrity tool must be configured to verify Access Control Lists (ACLs).

V-230553.name: V-230553
V-230553.description: The graphical display manager must not be installed on RHEL 8 unless approved.

V-230554.name: V-230554
V-230554.description: RHEL 8 network interfaces must not be in promiscuous mode.

V-230555.name: V-230555
V-230555.description: RHEL 8 remote X connections for interactive users must be disabled unless to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.

V-230556.name: V-230556
V-230556.description: The RHEL 8 SSH daemon must prevent remote hosts from connecting to the proxy display.

V-230557.name: V-230557
V-230557.description: If the Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) server is required, the RHEL 8 TFTP daemon must be configured to operate in secure mode.

V-230558.name: V-230558
V-230558.description: A File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server package must not be installed unless mission essential on RHEL 8.

V-230559.name: V-230559
V-230559.description: The gssproxy package must not be installed unless mission essential on RHEL 8.

V-230560.name: V-230560
V-230560.description: The iprutils package must not be installed unless mission essential on RHEL 8.

V-230561.name: V-230561
V-230561.description: The tuned package must not be installed unless mission essential on RHEL 8.

V-237640.name: V-237640
V-237640.description: The krb5-server package must not be installed on RHEL 8.

V-237641.name: V-237641
V-237641.description: RHEL 8 must restrict privilege elevation to authorized personnel.

V-237642.name: V-237642
V-237642.description: RHEL 8 must use the invoking user's password for privilege escalation when using 'sudo'.

V-237643.name: V-237643
V-237643.description: RHEL 8 must require re-authentication when using the 'sudo' command.

V-244519.name: V-244519
V-244519.description: RHEL 8 must display a banner before granting local or remote access to the system via a graphical user logon.

V-244521.name: V-244521
V-244521.description: RHEL 8 operating systems booted with United Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) must require a unique superusers name upon booting into single-user mode and maintenance.

V-244522.name: V-244522
V-244522.description: RHEL 8 operating systems booted with a BIOS must require  a unique superusers name upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes.

V-244523.name: V-244523
V-244523.description: RHEL 8 operating systems must require authentication upon booting into emergency mode.

V-244524.name: V-244524
V-244524.description: The RHEL 8 pam_unix.so module must be configured in the system-auth file to use a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm for system authentication.

V-244525.name: V-244525
V-244525.description: RHEL 8 must be configured so that all network connections associated with SSH traffic are terminated after 10 minutes of becoming unresponsive.

V-244526.name: V-244526
V-244526.description: The RHEL 8 SSH daemon must be configured to use system-wide crypto policies.

V-244527.name: V-244527
V-244527.description: RHEL 8 must have the packages required to use the hardware random number generator entropy gatherer service.

V-244528.name: V-244528
V-244528.description: The RHEL 8 SSH daemon must not allow GSSAPI authentication, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.

V-244529.name: V-244529
V-244529.description: RHEL 8 must use a separate file system for /var/tmp.

V-244530.name: V-244530
V-244530.description: RHEL 8 must prevent files with the setuid and setgid bit set from being executed on the /boot/efi directory.

V-244531.name: V-244531
V-244531.description: All RHEL 8 local interactive user home directory files must have mode 0750 or less permissive.

V-244532.name: V-244532
V-244532.description: RHEL 8 must be configured so that all files and directories contained in local interactive user home directories are group-owned by a group of which the home directory owner is a member.

V-244533.name: V-244533
V-244533.description: RHEL 8 must configure the use of the pam_faillock.so module in the /etc/pam.d/system-auth file.

V-244534.name: V-244534
V-244534.description: RHEL 8 must configure the use of the pam_faillock.so module in the /etc/pam.d/password-auth file.

V-244535.name: V-244535
V-244535.description: RHEL 8 must initiate a session lock for graphical user interfaces when the screensaver is activated.

V-244536.name: V-244536
V-244536.description: RHEL 8 must disable the user list at logon for graphical user interfaces.

V-244537.name: V-244537
V-244537.description: RHEL 8 must have the tmux package installed.

V-244538.name: V-244538
V-244538.description: RHEL 8 must prevent a user from overriding the session idle-delay setting for the graphical user interface.

V-244539.name: V-244539
V-244539.description: RHEL 8 must prevent a user from overriding the screensaver lock-enabled setting for the graphical user interface.

V-244540.name: V-244540
V-244540.description: RHEL 8 must not allow blank or null passwords in the system-auth file.

V-244541.name: V-244541
V-244541.description: RHEL 8 must not allow blank or null passwords in the password-auth file.

V-244542.name: V-244542
V-244542.description: RHEL 8 audit records must contain information to establish what type of events occurred, the source of events, where events occurred, and the outcome of events.

V-244543.name: V-244543
V-244543.description: RHEL 8 must notify the System Administrator (SA) and Information System Security Officer (ISSO) (at a minimum) when allocated audit record storage volume 75 percent utilization.

V-244544.name: V-244544
V-244544.description: A firewall must be active on RHEL 8.

V-244545.name: V-244545
V-244545.description: The RHEL 8 fapolicy module must be enabled.

V-244546.name: V-244546
V-244546.description: The RHEL 8 fapolicy module must be configured to employ a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs.

V-244547.name: V-244547
V-244547.description: RHEL 8 must have the USBGuard installed.

V-244549.name: V-244549
V-244549.description: All RHEL 8 networked systems must have SSH installed.

V-244550.name: V-244550
V-244550.description: RHEL 8 must prevent IPv4 Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages from being accepted.

V-244551.name: V-244551
V-244551.description: RHEL 8 must not forward IPv4 source-routed packets.

V-244552.name: V-244552
V-244552.description: RHEL 8 must not forward IPv4 source-routed packets by default.

V-244553.name: V-244553
V-244553.description: RHEL 8 must ignore IPv4 Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages.

V-244554.name: V-244554
V-244554.description: RHEL 8 must enable hardening for the Berkeley Packet Filter Just-in-time compiler.

V-245540.name: V-245540
V-245540.description: The RHEL 8 operating system must implement the Endpoint Security for Linux Threat Prevention tool.

V-250315.name: V-250315
V-250315.description: RHEL 8 systems, versions 8.2 and above, must configure SELinux context type to allow the use of a non-default faillock tally directory.

V-250316.name: V-250316
V-250316.description: RHEL 8 systems below version 8.2 must configure SELinux context type to allow the use of a non-default faillock tally directory.

V-250317.name: V-250317
V-250317.description: RHEL 8 must not enable IPv4 packet forwarding unless the system is a router.

V-251706.name: V-251706
V-251706.description: The RHEL 8 operating system must not have accounts configured with blank or null passwords.

V-251707.name: V-251707
V-251707.description: RHEL 8 library directories must have mode 755 or less permissive.

V-251708.name: V-251708
V-251708.description: RHEL 8 library directories must be owned by root.

V-251709.name: V-251709
V-251709.description: RHEL 8 library directories must be group-owned by root or a system account.

V-251710.name: V-251710
V-251710.description: The RHEL 8 operating system must use a file integrity tool to verify correct operation of all security functions.

V-251711.name: V-251711
V-251711.description: RHEL 8 must specify the default 'include' directory for the /etc/sudoers file.

V-251712.name: V-251712
V-251712.description: The RHEL 8 operating system must not be configured to bypass password requirements for privilege escalation.

V-251713.name: V-251713
V-251713.description: RHEL 8 must ensure the password complexity module is enabled in the system-auth file.

V-251714.name: V-251714
V-251714.description: RHEL 8 systems below version 8.4 must ensure the password complexity module in the system-auth file is configured for three retries or less.

V-251715.name: V-251715
V-251715.description: RHEL 8 systems below version 8.4 must ensure the password complexity module in the password-auth file is configured for three retries or less.

V-251716.name: V-251716
V-251716.description: RHEL 8 systems, version 8.4 and above, must ensure the password complexity module is configured for three retries or less.

V-251717.name: V-251717
V-251717.description: RHEL 8 must be configured in the system-auth file to prohibit password reuse for a minimum of five generations.

V-251718.name: V-251718
V-251718.description: The graphical display manager must not be the default target on RHEL 8 unless approved.

V-254520.name: V-254520
V-254520.description: RHEL 8 must prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions, including disabling, circumventing, or altering implemented security safeguards/countermeasures.

V-255924.name: V-255924
V-255924.description: RHEL 8 SSH server must be configured to use only FIPS-validated key exchange algorithms.

V-256973.name: V-256973
V-256973.description: RHEL 8 must ensure cryptographic verification of vendor software packages.

V-256974.name: V-256974
V-256974.description: RHEL 8 must be configured to allow sending email notifications of unauthorized configuration changes to designated personnel.

V-257258.name: V-257258
V-257258.description: RHEL 8 must terminate idle user sessions.
